nexttext: where $d$ is the one-bit link-selection parameter, and $\rho$ is a positive statistical parameter that depends on average channel gains. $\rho$  is chosen to maximize  rate while ensuring buffer stability. We assume that SS always has data to transmit, and that SR has an infinite-sized buffer and choose $\rho$  such that the rate is maximised. Hence the average rate of ALSBR is:

prevtext: where $d$ is the one-bit link-selection parameter, and $\rho$ is a positive statistical parameter that depends on average channel gains. $\rho$  is chosen to maximize  rate while ensuring buffer stability. We assume that SS always has data to transmit, and that SR has an infinite-sized buffer and choose $\rho$  such that the rate is maximised. Hence the average rate of ALSBR is:
